elements.content: Two new (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, from Cu-paddelwheel units and 5-[4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl]­isophthalic acid (L1) and 5-[3′-amino-4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl]­isophthalic acid (L2) have been synthesized, and interestingly, they exhibit relatively high surface area and large CH4 adsorption uptake.
elements.clean_text: Two new (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, from Cu-paddelwheel units and 5-[4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl]isophthalic acid (L1) and 5-[3'-amino-4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl]isophthalic acid (L2) have been synthesized, and interestingly, they exhibit relatively high surface area and large CH4 adsorption uptake.

elements.content:
Two new (3,6)-connected MOFs with eea topology and high methane uptake have been synthesized.

Natural gas, mainly containing methane, has been considered to be the practicable and valuable alternative fuel in the short term due to low cost and clean-burning characteristics, in comparison with gasoline. However, owing to the low volumetric energy density, the efficient and safe storage of methane is still a great challenge for its application. With CH4 restrained at the surface of the adsorbents, adsorbed natural gas (ANG) represents one promising approach which can achieve high-density CH4 storage at ambient temperature and moderate pressure. In the past decades, much effort has been made to investigate methane storage on different porous materials. Nevertheless, the difficulty in tuning pore shapes and sizes in activated carbons, as well as the limited number of structures, low surface area, and hydrophilicity of zeolites limit the utility of these materials in natural gas storage.
elements.clean_text:
Two new (3,6)-connected MOFs with eea topology and high methane uptake have been synthesized.

Natural gas, mainly containing methane, has been considered to be the practicable and valuable alternative fuel in the short term due to low cost and clean-burning characteristics, in comparison with gasoline. However, owing to the low volumetric energy density, the efficient and safe storage of methane is still a great challenge for its application. With CH4 restrained at the surface of the adsorbents, adsorbed natural gas (ANG) represents one promising approach which can achieve high-density CH4 storage at ambient temperature and moderate pressure. In the past decades, much effort has been made to investigate methane storage on different porous materials. Nevertheless, the difficulty in tuning pore shapes and sizes in activated carbons, as well as the limited number of structures, low surface area, and hydrophilicity of zeolites limit the utility of these materials in natural gas storage.

elements.content: In recent years, metal–organic frameworks (MOFs), with the unique feature of combining the benefits of both zeolites and porous carbons, have been recognized to be the promising porous materials for natural gas storage due to their high porosity, high surface area and pore volume, and tunable structures and properties. At present, many MOFs with open metal sites have been given great attention, such as HKUST-1, UTSA-76, NOTT-100/101, and PCN-14, which held the record for high storage of CH4 at that time. However, open metal sites in such MOFs may cause more susceptibility to the H2O vapor and relatively difficult desorption of adsorbed CH4 molecules at low pressures.
elements.clean_text: In recent years, metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), with the unique feature of combining the benefits of both zeolites and porous carbons, have been recognized to be the promising porous materials for natural gas storage due to their high porosity, high surface area and pore volume, and tunable structures and properties. At present, many MOFs with open metal sites have been given great attention, such as HKUST-1, UTSA-76, NOTT-100/101, and PCN-14, which held the record for high storage of CH4 at that time. However, open metal sites in such MOFs may cause more susceptibility to the H2O vapor and relatively difficult desorption of adsorbed CH4 molecules at low pressures.

elements.content: We have been exploring the construction of MOFs with interesting structures and energy and environmental issue related properties from both symmetric and unsymmetric multidentate organic ligands in the past 15 years. Very recently, based upon tridentate heterodonor linkers, 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid and 5-(pyrimid-5-yl)­isophthalic acid, respectively, two (3,6)-connected and rtl topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8, which show highly selective CO2/N2 adsorption, have been designed. In order to enhance the CH4 storage capacities of this kind MOF, herein, based upon two longer organic ligands, L1 and L2 (), new porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs [Cu­(L1 2–)] n ·xG, (G = Guest molecules, NJU-Bai30) and [Cu­(L2 2–)] n ·xG, (NJU-Bai31) with no open metal sites but larger surface area have been synthesized. Interestingly, their high surface areas of 1814 m2 g–1 for NJU-Bai30 and 1861 m2 g–1 for NJU-Bai31 are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date, and a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.
elements.clean_text: We have been exploring the construction of MOFs with interesting structures and energy and environmental issue related properties from both symmetric and unsymmetric multidentate organic ligands in the past 15 years. Very recently, based upon tridentate heterodonor linkers, 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid and 5-(pyrimid-5-yl)isophthalic acid, respectively, two (3,6)-connected and rtl topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8, which show highly selective CO2/N2 adsorption, have been designed. In order to enhance the CH4 storage capacities of this kind MOF, herein, based upon two longer organic ligands, L1 and L2 (), new porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs [Cu(L1 2-)] n ⋅xG, (G = Guest molecules, NJU-Bai30) and [Cu(L2 2-)] n ⋅xG, (NJU-Bai31) with no open metal sites but larger surface area have been synthesized. Interestingly, their high surface areas of 1814 m2 g-1 for NJU-Bai30 and 1861 m2 g-1 for NJU-Bai31 are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date, and a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.

<fig fig-type="scheme" id="sch1" position="float">

<title>Molecular Structures of L<sub>1</sub> and L<sub>2</sub>

elements.clean_text: 1  Molecular Structures of L1 and L2

elements.content: Solvothermal reactions of CuCl2·2H2O with L1 and L2 led to high yields of green block crystals of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, respectively. Crystallographic data revealed that both NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 crystallize in hexagonal space group R3̅m. NJU-Bai30 is isostructural with NJU-Bai31. In their structures, Cu-paddlewheel units connected by isophthalic acid moieties result in the formation of two-dimensional layered Kagomé lattices, which are further pillared by the 4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl and 3′-amino-4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl group in NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, respectively (). Along the c axis, these Kagomé layers in MOFs adopt the packing mode of the ABC stacking model. Thus, one-dimensional hourglass-shaped channels are generated to be perpendicular to the two-dimensional Kagomé layers in NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, which consist of two different cages A and B, alternatively connecting with each other through sharing windows (Figure S2). Their pore sizes (determined by the van der Waals diameter of the inserted pseudoatom) are 11.0 Å (A), 6.6 Å (B) and 10.8 Å (A), 7.0 Å (B), respectively (e,f), which are also consistent with those estimated from the pore size distributions by analyzing the N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K using the NLDFT method (Figure S8). For a better description of structures, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 may be described as a (3,6)-connected network with eea topology in which the Cu-paddlewheel units serve as 6-connected nodes and the organic ligands are simplified as 3-connected nodes.
elements.clean_text: Solvothermal reactions of CuCl2⋅2H2O with L1 and L2 led to high yields of green block crystals of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, respectively. Crystallographic data revealed that both NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 crystallize in hexagonal space group R3̅m. NJU-Bai30 is isostructural with NJU-Bai31. In their structures, Cu-paddlewheel units connected by isophthalic acid moieties result in the formation of two-dimensional layered Kagomé lattices, which are further pillared by the 4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl and 3'-amino-4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl group in NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, respectively (). Along the c axis, these Kagomé layers in MOFs adopt the packing mode of the ABC stacking model. Thus, one-dimensional hourglass-shaped channels are generated to be perpendicular to the two-dimensional Kagomé layers in NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, which consist of two different cages A and B, alternatively connecting with each other through sharing windows (Figure S2). Their pore sizes (determined by the van der Waals diameter of the inserted pseudoatom) are 11.0 Å (A), 6.6 Å (B) and 10.8 Å (A), 7.0 Å (B), respectively (e,f), which are also consistent with those estimated from the pore size distributions by analyzing the N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K using the NLDFT method (Figure S8). For a better description of structures, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 may be described as a (3,6)-connected network with eea topology in which the Cu-paddlewheel units serve as 6-connected nodes and the organic ligands are simplified as 3-connected nodes.

elements.content: (a,b) Cu-paddlewheel units connected by isophthalic acid moieties form the 2D Kagomé layers (represented in purple, gold and green in b) which are pillared by 4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl group to form 3D porous frameworks. (c) Structure of NJU-Bai30 viewed along c axis. (d) Schematic representation of the eea topological net of NJU-Bai30. (e,f) 1D hourglass-shaped channels with two kinds of cages, A (green ball) and B (pink ball), generated in NJU-Bai30 (e) and NJU-Bai31 (f) and their pore sizes. H atom is not shown for clarity. The gray, red, cyan, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, copper, and nitrogen atoms, respectively.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a,b) Cu-paddlewheel units connected by isophthalic acid moieties form the 2D Kagomé layers (represented in purple, gold and green in b) which are pillared by 4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl group to form 3D porous frameworks. (c) Structure of NJU-Bai30 viewed along c axis. (d) Schematic representation of the eea topological net of NJU-Bai30. (e,f) 1D hourglass-shaped channels with two kinds of cages, A (green ball) and B (pink ball), generated in NJU-Bai30 (e) and NJU-Bai31 (f) and their pore sizes. H atom is not shown for clarity. The gray, red, cyan, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, copper, and nitrogen atoms, respectively.

elements.content: Using the PLATON/SOLV program, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 are around 56.5% and 51.6%, respectively, and their densities are 0.8 g cm–3 (NJU-Bai30) and 0.848 g cm–3 (NJU-Bai31), respectively. Meanwhile, the phase purity and thermal stability of the bulk samples have been confirmed by power X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).
elements.clean_text: Using the PLATON/SOLV program, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 are around 56.5% and 51.6%, respectively, and their densities are 0.8 g cm-3 (NJU-Bai30) and 0.848 g cm-3 (NJU-Bai31), respectively. Meanwhile, the phase purity and thermal stability of the bulk samples have been confirmed by power X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).

elements.content: To explore the permanent porosity, their N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K were measured (Figure S6). Both exhibit reversible typical type-I isotherms which are characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent BET surface area and Langmuir surface area of NJU-Bai30 are 1814 and 1992 m2 g–1, while those of NJU-Bai31 are 1861 and about 2066 m2 g–1. They are smaller than those reported for MOF-5 (∼3800 m2 g–1) and MOF-177 (∼4500 m2 g–1). However, they are still among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. On the basis of N2 adsorption uptake at P/P 0 = 0.974, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 have calculated pore volumes of 0.75 and 0.74 cm3 g–1, respectively.
elements.clean_text: To explore the permanent porosity, their N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K were measured (Figure S6). Both exhibit reversible typical type-I isotherms which are characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent BET surface area and Langmuir surface area of NJU-Bai30 are 1814 and 1992 m2 g-1, while those of NJU-Bai31 are 1861 and about 2066 m2 g-1. They are smaller than those reported for MOF-5 (~3800 m2 g-1) and MOF-177 (~4500 m2 g-1). However, they are still among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. On the basis of N2 adsorption uptake at P/P 0 = 0.974, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 have calculated pore volumes of 0.75 and 0.74 cm3 g-1, respectively.

elements.content: The relatively high surface areas and large pore volumes of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 prompted us to examine their methane adsorption behavior further. Their high-pressure CH4 sorption isotherms were measured at ambient temperature from 0 to 100 bar (). At 35 bar and 298 K, the moderately practical conditions for CH4 storage, the total adsorption capacity of methane of NJU-Bai30 reaches 155 cm3 (STP) cm–3. This value is higher than those of famous MOF-177 (126 cm3 (STP) cm–3) under the same conditions. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 4.6 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 35 bar and 298 K (). At 65 bar and 298 K, the methane storage of NJU-Bai30 can further be increased to 186 cm3 (STP) cm–3, which is almost 71% of the new DOE’s target (263 cm3 (STP) cm–3). This value approaches those of M2(bdc)2(dabco), (M = Zn, Co, Cu), which have been considered to be the best reported MOFs without open metal sites for CH4 storage at ambient temperature to date (). Based upon this capacity, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 2.8 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 65 bar and 298 K (). Furthermore, as we expected, the methane storage capacity of NJU-Bai30 has been enhanced significantly in comparison with NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8 (). Its high CH4 storage capacity at 298 K and high pressures may be due to the relatively high surface area and suitable pore sizes (∼7 Å or ∼11 Å), which are very close 7.6 or 11.4 Å for the accommodation of CH4 molecules based upon the investigations of activated carbon materials.

Their high-pressure CH4 sorption isotherms were measured at ambient temperature from 0 to 100 bar (). At 35 bar and 298 K, the moderately practical conditions for CH4 storage, the total adsorption capacity of methane of NJU-Bai30 reaches 155 cm3 (STP) cm-3. This value is higher than those of famous MOF-177 (126 cm3 (STP) cm-3) under the same conditions. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 4.6 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 35 bar and 298 K (). At 65 bar and 298 K, the methane storage of NJU-Bai30 can further be increased to 186 cm3 (STP) cm-3, which is almost 71% of the new DOE's target (263 cm3 (STP) cm-3). This value approaches those of M2(bdc)2(dabco), (M = Zn, Co, Cu), which have been considered to be the best reported MOFs without open metal sites for CH4 storage at ambient temperature to date (). Based upon this capacity, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 2.8 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 65 bar and 298 K (). Furthermore, as we expected, the methane storage capacity of NJU-Bai30 has been enhanced significantly in comparison with NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8 (). Its high CH4 storage capacity at 298 K and high pressures may be due to the relatively high surface area and suitable pore sizes (~7 Å or ~11 Å), which are very close 7.6 or 11.4 Å for the accommodation of CH4 molecules based upon the investigations of activated carbon materials.

elements.content: Total CH4 volumetric uptake of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 at 298 K. Filled and open symbols represent adsorption and desorption, respectively. Bulk density of CH4 at 298 K is represented as the black line.
elements.clean_text: 2  Total CH4 volumetric uptake of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 at 298 K. Filled and open symbols represent adsorption and desorption, respectively. Bulk density of CH4 at 298 K is represented as the black line.

Methane Uptake of Typical MOFs without Open Metal Sites BET V p D c total CH4 uptake (cm3 cm–3) –Q st T materials (m2 g–1) (cm3 g–1) (g cm–3) 35 bar 65 bar (kJ mol–1) (K) bulk - - - 34 66 - 298 NJU-Bai8 1103 0.431 - 60 - - 298 Cu(dhbc)2(4,4′-bpy) - - 1.233 86 - - 298 NJU-Bai7 1155 0.439 - 95 - - 298 Cu(GeF6)(4,4′-bpy)2 - - 0.925 124 - 16.2 298 Cu(SiF6)(4,4′-bpy)2 , 1337 0.56 0.859 125 - 16.2 298 NJU-Bai31 1861 0.74 0.848 127 158 18.8 298 NJU-Bai30 1814 0.75 0.8 155 186 17.5 298 Cu2(bdc)2(dabco) , 1548 0.58 - 180 - 16.19 298 Co2(bdc)2(dabco) 1600 0.82 0.815 161 199 - 303 Zn2(bdc)2(dabco) − 1448 0.75 0.87 174 212 15.1 303

Saturation excess uptake at 20 bar estimated from the CH4 adsorption isotherm at 298 K.

Adsorption uptake at 36 bar.

Not specified whether uptake is in terms of excess, total, or absolute adsorption. dhbc = 2,5-dihydroxybenzoic acid; bdc = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate; dabco = 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]­octane.

NJU-Bai31 allowed us to elucidate the effect of the amine upon CH4 uptake, as it can be directly compared to the isoreticular NJU-Bai30. At 298 K, it adsorbs CH4 with total volumetric uptake of 127 cm3 (STP) cm–3 at 35 bar and 158 cm3 (STP) cm–3 at 65 bar, respectively, indicating that the introduction of functional groups may decrease the CH4 storage of this kind MOFs, which may be ascribed to the less usable free volume in NJU-Bai31. However, its methane uptake is still higher than the values of some typical high CH4 storage MOFs without open metal sites, for example, MOF-200 and IRMOF-8. Its values are ∼3.7 and ∼2.4 times the empty container amount at 298 K, 35 and 65 bar, respectively.
elements.clean_text: NJU-Bai31 allowed us to elucidate the effect of the amine upon CH4 uptake, as it can be directly compared to the isoreticular NJU-Bai30. At 298 K, it adsorbs CH4 with total volumetric uptake of 127 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 35 bar and 158 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 65 bar, respectively, indicating that the introduction of functional groups may decrease the CH4 storage of this kind MOFs, which may be ascribed to the less usable free volume in NJU-Bai31. However, its methane uptake is still higher than the values of some typical high CH4 storage MOFs without open metal sites, for example, MOF-200 and IRMOF-8. Its values are ~3.7 and ~2.4 times the empty container amount at 298 K, 35 and 65 bar, respectively.

elements.content: In summary, based upon two longer organic ligands, 5-[4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl]­isophthalic acid (L1) and 5-[3′-amino-4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl]­isophthalic acid (L2), two new more porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, have been successfully synthesized. They exhibit higher surface areas and larger CH4 gas storage capacities in comparison with our previous MOFs, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8. Their high surface areas are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.
elements.clean_text: In summary, based upon two longer organic ligands, 5-[4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl]isophthalic acid (L1) and 5-[3'-amino-4'-(pyridin-4-yl)phenyl]isophthalic acid (L2), two new more porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31, have been successfully synthesized. They exhibit higher surface areas and larger CH4 gas storage capacities in comparison with our previous MOFs, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8. Their high surface areas are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.

cln_elements.content:
We have been exploring the construction of MOFs with interesting structures and energy and environmental issue related properties from both symmetric and unsymmetric multidentate organic ligands in the past 15 years. Very recently, based upon tridentate heterodonor linkers, 5-(pyridin-3-yl)­isophthalic acid and 5-(pyrimid-5-yl)­isophthalic acid, respectively, two (3,6)-connected and rtl topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8, which show highly selective CO2/N2 adsorption, have been designed. In order to enhance the CH4 storage capacities of this kind MOF, herein, based upon two longer organic ligands, L1 and L2 (), new porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs [Cu­(L1 2–)] n ·xG, (G = Guest molecules, NJU-Bai30) and [Cu­(L2 2–)] n ·xG, (NJU-Bai31) with no open metal sites but larger surface area have been synthesized. Interestingly, their high surface areas of 1814 m2 g–1 for NJU-Bai30 and 1861 m2 g–1 for NJU-Bai31 are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date, and a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.

Using the PLATON/SOLV program, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 are around 56.5% and 51.6%, respectively, and their densities are 0.8 g cm–3 (NJU-Bai30) and 0.848 g cm–3 (NJU-Bai31), respectively. Meanwhile, the phase purity and thermal stability of the bulk samples have been confirmed by power X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).

To explore the permanent porosity, their N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K were measured (Figure S6). Both exhibit reversible typical type-I isotherms which are characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent BET surface area and Langmuir surface area of NJU-Bai30 are 1814 and 1992 m2 g–1, while those of NJU-Bai31 are 1861 and about 2066 m2 g–1. They are smaller than those reported for MOF-5 (∼3800 m2 g–1) and MOF-177 (∼4500 m2 g–1). However, they are still among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. On the basis of N2 adsorption uptake at P/P 0 = 0.974, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 have calculated pore volumes of 0.75 and 0.74 cm3 g–1, respectively.

The relatively high surface areas and large pore volumes of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 prompted us to examine their methane adsorption behavior further. Their high-pressure CH4 sorption isotherms were measured at ambient temperature from 0 to 100 bar (). At 35 bar and 298 K, the moderately practical conditions for CH4 storage, the total adsorption capacity of methane of NJU-Bai30 reaches 155 cm3 (STP) cm–3. This value is higher than those of famous MOF-177 (126 cm3 (STP) cm–3) under the same conditions. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 4.6 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 35 bar and 298 K (). At 65 bar and 298 K, the methane storage of NJU-Bai30 can further be increased to 186 cm3 (STP) cm–3, which is almost 71% of the new DOE’s target (263 cm3 (STP) cm–3). This value approaches those of M2(bdc)2(dabco), (M = Zn, Co, Cu), which have been considered to be the best reported MOFs without open metal sites for CH4 storage at ambient temperature to date (). Based upon this capacity, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 2.8 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 65 bar and 298 K (). Furthermore, as we expected, the methane storage capacity of NJU-Bai30 has been enhanced significantly in comparison with NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8 (). Its high CH4 storage capacity at 298 K and high pressures may be due to the relatively high surface area and suitable pore sizes (∼7 Å or ∼11 Å), which are very close 7.6 or 11.4 Å for the accommodation of CH4 molecules based upon the investigations of activated carbon materials.

NJU-Bai31 allowed us to elucidate the effect of the amine upon CH4 uptake, as it can be directly compared to the isoreticular NJU-Bai30. At 298 K, it adsorbs CH4 with total volumetric uptake of 127 cm3 (STP) cm–3 at 35 bar and 158 cm3 (STP) cm–3 at 65 bar, respectively, indicating that the introduction of functional groups may decrease the CH4 storage of this kind MOFs, which may be ascribed to the less usable free volume in NJU-Bai31. However, its methane uptake is still higher than the values of some typical high CH4 storage MOFs without open metal sites, for example, MOF-200 and IRMOF-8. Its values are ∼3.7 and ∼2.4 times the empty container amount at 298 K, 35 and 65 bar, respectively.
cln_elements.clean_text:
We have been exploring the construction of MOFs with interesting structures and energy and environmental issue related properties from both symmetric and unsymmetric multidentate organic ligands in the past 15 years. Very recently, based upon tridentate heterodonor linkers, 5-(pyridin-3-yl)isophthalic acid and 5-(pyrimid-5-yl)isophthalic acid, respectively, two (3,6)-connected and rtl topological MOFs without open metal sites, NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8, which show highly selective CO2/N2 adsorption, have been designed. In order to enhance the CH4 storage capacities of this kind MOF, herein, based upon two longer organic ligands, L1 and L2 (), new porous (3,6)-connected and eea topological MOFs [Cu(L1 2-)] n ⋅xG, (G = Guest molecules, NJU-Bai30) and [Cu(L2 2-)] n ⋅xG, (NJU-Bai31) with no open metal sites but larger surface area have been synthesized. Interestingly, their high surface areas of 1814 m2 g-1 for NJU-Bai30 and 1861 m2 g-1 for NJU-Bai31 are among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date, and a container filled with NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 can store multiple amounts of CH4 in an empty container at the same conditions.

Using the PLATON/SOLV program, the total potential solvent accessible volumes in desolvated NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 are around 56.5% and 51.6%, respectively, and their densities are 0.8 g cm-3 (NJU-Bai30) and 0.848 g cm-3 (NJU-Bai31), respectively. Meanwhile, the phase purity and thermal stability of the bulk samples have been confirmed by power X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA).

To explore the permanent porosity, their N2 adsorption isotherms at 77 K were measured (Figure S6). Both exhibit reversible typical type-I isotherms which are characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent BET surface area and Langmuir surface area of NJU-Bai30 are 1814 and 1992 m2 g-1, while those of NJU-Bai31 are 1861 and about 2066 m2 g-1. They are smaller than those reported for MOF-5 (~3800 m2 g-1) and MOF-177 (~4500 m2 g-1). However, they are still among the highest values for MOFs without open metal sites reported to date. On the basis of N2 adsorption uptake at P/P 0 = 0.974, NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 have calculated pore volumes of 0.75 and 0.74 cm3 g-1, respectively.

The relatively high surface areas and large pore volumes of NJU-Bai30 and NJU-Bai31 prompted us to examine their methane adsorption behavior further. Their high-pressure CH4 sorption isotherms were measured at ambient temperature from 0 to 100 bar (). At 35 bar and 298 K, the moderately practical conditions for CH4 storage, the total adsorption capacity of methane of NJU-Bai30 reaches 155 cm3 (STP) cm-3. This value is higher than those of famous MOF-177 (126 cm3 (STP) cm-3) under the same conditions. Interestingly, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 4.6 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 35 bar and 298 K (). At 65 bar and 298 K, the methane storage of NJU-Bai30 can further be increased to 186 cm3 (STP) cm-3, which is almost 71% of the new DOE's target (263 cm3 (STP) cm-3). This value approaches those of M2(bdc)2(dabco), (M = Zn, Co, Cu), which have been considered to be the best reported MOFs without open metal sites for CH4 storage at ambient temperature to date (). Based upon this capacity, a container filled with NJU-Bai30 can store about 2.8 times the amount of CH4 in an empty container at 65 bar and 298 K (). Furthermore, as we expected, the methane storage capacity of NJU-Bai30 has been enhanced significantly in comparison with NJU-Bai7 and NJU-Bai8 (). Its high CH4 storage capacity at 298 K and high pressures may be due to the relatively high surface area and suitable pore sizes (~7 Å or ~11 Å), which are very close 7.6 or 11.4 Å for the accommodation of CH4 molecules based upon the investigations of activated carbon materials. 

NJU-Bai31 allowed us to elucidate the effect of the amine upon CH4 uptake, as it can be directly compared to the isoreticular NJU-Bai30. At 298 K, it adsorbs CH4 with total volumetric uptake of 127 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 35 bar and 158 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 65 bar, respectively, indicating that the introduction of functional groups may decrease the CH4 storage of this kind MOFs, which may be ascribed to the less usable free volume in NJU-Bai31. However, its methane uptake is still higher than the values of some typical high CH4 storage MOFs without open metal sites, for example, MOF-200 and IRMOF-8. Its values are ~3.7 and ~2.4 times the empty container amount at 298 K, 35 and 65 bar, respectively.

cln_elements.clean_text: 1  Molecular Structures of L1 and L2

cln_elements.content: (a,b) Cu-paddlewheel units connected by isophthalic acid moieties form the 2D Kagomé layers (represented in purple, gold and green in b) which are pillared by 4′-(pyridin-4-yl)­phenyl group to form 3D porous frameworks. (c) Structure of NJU-Bai30 viewed along c axis. (d) Schematic representation of the eea topological net of NJU-Bai30. (e,f) 1D hourglass-shaped channels with two kinds of cages, A (green ball) and B (pink ball), generated in NJU-Bai30 (e) and NJU-Bai31 (f) and their pore sizes. H atom is not shown for clarity. The gray, red, cyan, and blue spheres represent carbon, oxygen, copper, and nitrogen atoms, respectively.

metadata.title:
Two New (3,6)-Connected MOFs with eea Topology and
High CH4 Uptake
